name: Embassy Hotel and Suites

reviews.text: This has been the sixth stayfor us at the Embassy Suites. We travel once or twice a year to visit a daughter at the University of Ottawa. The location is fantastic-right by the bridge over the canal to the university. The kitchenttes are really convenient, staff is friendly and there is everything one could want. The location cannot be beat as it is within walking distance to the Byward market, the parliament buildings, parks, Elgin street etc.
reviews.title: As usual, a great stay!

reviews.text: Although dated, it is in a perfect part of town. Everything is walkable - lots of restaurants around. It is so nice to have a kitchen and livingroom area so you do not have to sit on a bed to watch TV or talk. Also had a balcony and we had beautiful evenings to enjoy
reviews.title: Loved the fact that we had a living room so did not have to sit on beds or hard chairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night last weekend. After reading the reviews, didn't really know what to expect. Rooms were a good size, huge closets, bathrooms were good (nice soap) and great water pressure. Bed was comfortable. Only issue we found was the parking. Can only park until 7am on street, and parking across the lot before 3am means you have to pay $13 a night to last until th enext afternoon at checkout time. Overall, for the price we paid it was great value. Would recommend to stay here in future.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights during the Tulip Festival, in May 2011. Location is very good and you get parking, indoor or outdoor, for $19. The staff was very nice and helpful when we asked for parking or information about the Festival. Apartment had kitchenette, was large and well organized. The bed was actually a double and not a queen, the furniture and appliances from kitchenette were pretty dated. It was through functional and all in all a good value for the money
reviews.title: Tulip Festival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to booking the Embasay Suites I checked the reviews of which some did not fare very well. Subsequently I only booked for one night with the intention of moving to another hotel for the remainder of our holiday if we didnt like it. However when we arrived we found the room although dated, was very clean. It had a small kitchen, sitting room with a large couch, walk-in closet and large walk-out balcony. The only complaint was the parking situation which is to say, there was none other than on the street where you had to move it by 8 am or risk a ticket. Inspite of the parking issue we stayed there another 2 days and worked around the parking issue which involved using a pay parking lot ( which has some unusual metered hours) across the road from the hotel and jockeyed the car around on the various streets at other hours.
reviews.title: Better than I thought

reviews.text: Location -- very good. It's actually within walking distance to the big shopping/tourist areas in Ottawa, that is, if you are like me, don't mind a bit of walking. There is a shortcut -- through the city hall building -- which will get you to the shopping area directly.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Room -- very large and with a full kitchen. It's really good if you want to stay for some time and do your own cooking. My room also had a niche area (like a walk-in closet without doors) beside the bedroom, which might be a good place for a crib if you have a young child. The furniture and bathroom fixtures are all 3-star level, nothing fancy. If you are used to 4-star hotels, this might feel a big grungy. But it is only a 3-star hotel. The same goes for the reception area, the main hall, and the elevator, which are all very small.
reviews.title: Good value -- great location

reviews.text: The only thing I would like to complain about this hotel is that I lost one clothes hanger in this hotel and can't retrieve it afterwards. It is no big deal, but the clothes hanger was designed for my suitcase, so it was really inconvenient without it. I forgot it in one of the closets and later called the hotel to ask if they had seen it and they couldn't find it.
reviews.title: Great location and very friendly staff!

reviews.text: We had a large 1 bedroom suite on the top (11th floor) .. it was well equipped with dishes etc ..the negatives were that we had requested a non-smoking room but did not get it (they had an ozonator running when we got into the room but it only had very limited effect) and the bedroom had 2 double beds instead of 1 queen bed. The room really needed upgrading -- the carpet had many large "wrinkles" in it (not to mention cigarette burns everywhere), bathroom had no exhaust fan, hinges were very rusty and a coat of paint was really needed. We were there at the end of Sept/beginning of Oct and they hadn't turned on the heating system so we were very cold in our room -- eventually got a portable heater from maintenance which was fine. Now, for the good stuff -- location is excellent -- we walked everywhere from the Parliament Buildings to Rideau Hall and all the sights in between .. this hotel is just 2 blocks from the Rideau canal. There is a string of restaurants within 3-4 blocks so lots of choice .. the hotel has a "breakfast nook" restaurant but it is not open weekends so be aware of that. Would stay again but insist on a non-smoking room..
reviews.title: It's 3 star for a reason.

reviews.text: Spent one night here for business and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is average - clean, but a bit outdated, definately not upscale if that is what you are looking for. The location is very close to restaurants and the canal. Each room has a kitchen - stove/oven, sink, refrigerator. I could see that this would be nice to have for a more extended stay.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The location is great. Decor and appliances are tired and date from the 80s at best. The fitness centre does not have air conditioning and is like a sauna. Parking is extremely limited and this was not explained to my 84 year old mother before she booked. After my mother complained about having to feed a meter every hour and ultimately getting a parking ticket, the British clerk at the front desk was extremely rude to her. I do not recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Rude desk clerk

reviews.text: While the Embassy might not be the most up to date in terms of interiors and furniture, it is most definitely one of the finer locations in Ottawa when you're on a budget. Located just off Elgin St. and minutes away to a wide range of restaurants and pubs, it's a great spot to stay while in the city.
reviews.title: Comfortable and spacious

reviews.text: Rooms are huge, with a kitchenette and a walk in closet area. Most rooms also have balconies, which although in need of work, offer a nice place to enjoy a sunset.
reviews.title: Ideal location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hopefully we'll see some renovation in the next few years. The carpets have to go.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Spacious Rooms, Reasonable Price

reviews.text: Embassy hotel is ideally located within walking distance to Parliament Hill and restaurants, shops, etc.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.text: Embassy Hotel and Suites is well located but could benefit from some modernizing. The rooms are spacious and well appointed with kitchenettes. We had no problems at the hotel with the room or the staff although I will agree with others that the elevator was sometimes frustratingly slow. Ottawa over Canada Day weekend is fabulous and we enjoyed our stay there.
reviews.title: Adequate Accommodation
Choose someplace else
reviews.text: Arrived late on July 1 holiday. Hotel had no parking spaces left and spent an hour driving around looking for one. Had to unload wife and luggage in rain and walk back 4 blocks from city garage. Hotel reception was rude and disrepectful. When I asked for help looking for parking the reception person shtugged his shoulders and said "what do you want mke to do about it? No smile, no welcome, acted as though I was a nuisance to be even staying there. Pay little more and stay at a classier place - not worth spoiling your holiday to experience this treatment. Elevators erratic. AC in room was whining and noisy. Toilet did not flush. More like a Motel 6.

reviews.title: Great family hotel!
reviews.text: This is a wonderful place to stay during Winterlude - walking distance to lots of restaurants, Confederation Park and the Rideau Canal. Lots of room in the suites and friendly and efficient service. Highly recommended!

If you're looking for a big room with basic amenities and a kitchen, this is the place. If you're looking for a warm welcome and/or any hospitality from the front desk - look elsewhere. I had read this hotel was trapped in the 70's, it wasn't THAT bad, and we were hoping to find a place we could cook. That came in real handy, full size stove, full size fridge, would be great for families - room was clean with funky arse 80's looking carpet. The price was right for how many nights we needed to stay... but, I felt like we were putting the staff OUT of their way just by checking in. There was not one time we went by the desk that we received as much as a hello, how ya doin. When we checked out I asked for them to call us a cab. The person barely replied, looked out the window and said "oh there's one" (which was actually a cab turning and driving away). I'm sure this hotel doesn't pay their staff didley or something because they could care less. But like I said, if you want an affordable room walking dist to everything with a kitchen, this is it.
reviews.title: Big room, great price, staff could care less about you being there.

reviews.text: We spent two night at the Embassy Hotel and Suites. This place is a all suite hotel with about 90% of their rooms have a kitchen, living room, beds and washroon and for the price we paid we got a bargain $79.00 plus $ 8.00 dollars to park. Which is quite cheap for this time in Ottawa. We had a room on the 6th floor and the room was extremly clean, the Air Conditioning was awesome. It was right in the middle of the downtown area so you could walk to everything including the Parliament buildings and the Rideau Center. All the staff were extremly friendly and very helpful and went out of their way to make sure our stay was great. THe resturant (The Study Lounge) was very reasonable and the food was mmm mmmm good. We had a great waitress Robyn. I couldn't find a negative thing about the place. So if you want Fairmont Chateau Laurier or Lord Elgin quality and don't want to pay the high cost to stay there I strongly advise you stayhere. Contact Patrick or Vanessa for excellent reservation service. I will be returning again soon.
reviews.title: A secret in Ottawa.

reviews.text: I travelled to Ottawa for my visa stamping at the consulate. The best proximity to the US consulate is Embassy suites which is at walking distance.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel right in the heart of the city makes it a good bet. The rooms are excellent for a longer stay and the kitchen facility provided makes it even for convenient.
reviews.title: great place ....will come again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the major attractions of Ottawa are just a stroll away and one can easily walk around from the hotel. Be it shopping, attractions, food etc, all is available at walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: fine suites in great location

reviews.text: Overall a best bet if you are in Ottawa for a business or leisure trip!
reviews.title: Inexpensive, clean, centrally located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cold in Jan .but had fun....lots of things to see and do...will come again for sure
reviews.title: Good location - but very tired
great place to stay
reviews.text: We just returned from spending 2 nights at the Embassy Hotel & Suites on our vacation. The hotel is located downtown and within walking distance to everything. We parked our car for 2 days and were able to walk to all the attractions. The hotel itself is clean, not overly fancy, but everything that we needed. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Situated one block from Elgin Street, where there are many fine restaurants. We had no problem finding a great place to eat.....we had dinner at Maxwells (great!) The only negative that I found was that the hotel's restaurant was not open on weekends, and that's when we were there. But it really wasn't a problem to find another place to eat. You also have to pay for parking, but I think that is the norm at all the hotels. We paid $8.00 a day....well worth it. We would definitely stay at the Embassy again!

description: Experience the best hotel with suites in Ottawa! Our bright, spacious and well-appointed guestrooms offer a variety of floor plans to choose from with two double beds, queen beds or king beds. Ottawa offers you a perfect starting point for exploring countless attractions and endless adventures. With the cost of an entire suite less than a single hotel room, the Embassy Hotel & Suites in Downtown Ottawa, Ontario offers comfort, choice and convenience. Take time to celebrate, it's all waiting to welcome you!
